author: Robert Stickles
subject: Re: BIG Lupin news!!
body:
>From: "DANIEL ZELTER" <danielzelter@hotmail.com>
>Reply-To: lupin@mcs.kent.edu
>To: lupin@mcs.kent.edu
>Subject: Re: [lupin] BIG Lupin news!!
>Date: Sun, 24 Feb 2002 19:59:08 -0800
>
>I'm guessing Columbus Files is Fujiko's Unlucky Days, since that did focus
>on the Columbus Egg. I'll ask Funi at AOD as soon as ANS posts my news.
>



_Voyage to Danger_ is _Orders to Assassinate Lupin_ (aka Dark Order of 
Assassination).  I've seen this title before from the NTV info files 
(Hawaiian TV?) which refer to Lupin as "Cliff" (a throwback to Stern's 
_Cliffhanger_ arcade game that featured Lupin).

     The only unclaimed TV Specials now are Riddle of the Hemmingway Papers, 
The Race for Napoleans Dictionary, From Russia with Love, and The Alcatraz 
Connection.
The first four are generally considered to be of poorer quality than later 
TV specials (animation and story-wise, although Hemmingway hasnt yet been 
translated to english) so I wonder if Funi is waiting to see how the more 
popular specials fare before tackling these.

     Manga UK owns the rights to Liberty Crisis but Funi could release it in 
North America; a similar situation happened with Streamline in the early 
90's where Castle of Cagliostro and Mystery/Secret of Mamo were handled in 
the UK by Manga.

BTW, this is *terrific* news... I'm very excited that Funimation is so 
enthusiastic about Lupin III.  It's been a great year for "old school" anime 
fans, with Rhino's slow but so far steady release of Gatchaman paired with 
Battle of the Planets and Animeigo's release of the original Macross.

Regards,
Rob S.
